data.text: At this also my heart is troubled,
Hear thou a report by the anger of the Lordâ€™s wrath,
His dominion is under the whole heaven,
After him shall be a cry with a loud voice;
The Mighty One shall thunder wonderfully with his voice:
Commanding the snow, Be thou upon the earth,
He seals up the hand of every man,
And the wild beasts come in under the covert,
Troubles come on out of the secret chambers,
And from the breath of the Mighty One he will send frost;
And if a cloud obscures what is precious to him,
And he will carry round the encircling clouds by his governance, to perform their works:
This has been appointed by him on the earth,
Hearken to this, O Job: stand still,
We know that God has disposed his works,
And he knows the divisions of the clouds,
But thy robe is warm,
Wilt thou establish with him foundations for the ancient heavens?
Wherefore teach me, what shall we say to him?
Have I a book or a scribe by me,
But the light is not visible to all:
From the north come the clouds shining like gold:
And we do not find another his equal in strength:
Wherefore men shall fear him;
